Appendix B. Sample Installations

This appendix contains output from installation sessions using the lsfsetup command. These listings correspond to procedures given in 'Installation', and 'Configuring LSF Cluster'.

Install for the First Time

# ./lsfsetup 
    L O A D   S H A R I N G   F A C I L I T Y   V E R S I O N   3 . 0

    Copyright 1992 -- 1996 by Platform Computing Corporation.
    All rights reserved.


Initializing ...

HELP:
    If you want help with any of the questions asked, enter ? at the prompt.


Please choose one of the following options:

    1.  Install for the First Time 
    2.  Install Another Host Type (for a mixed cluster)
    3.  Upgrade From a Previous Version
    4.  License Management
    5.  Configure LSF Cluster
    6.  Host Setup
    7.  De-install LSF

    ?.  Help
    q.  Quit

Please enter your choice: 1

Please specify one or more of the following components to install:

    1.  Batch (default)
    2.  JobScheduler
    3.  MulitCluster
    4.  Base-only

    ?.  Help
    q.  Quit

Please enter your choice(s) separated by comma (e.g., 1,3)? [1] 1

    This software is furnished under a license and may be used and
    copied only in accordance with the terms of such license and with
    the inclusion of the above copyright notice. This software or any
    other copies thereof may not be provided or otherwise made available
    to any other person. No title to and ownership of the software is
    hereby transferred.

    You must have a software license key to run LSF.  If you do not have
    a license key, contact your LSF vendor and obtain one before
    attempting to run LSF.

Have you purchased LSF? (y/n) [n] y


    This installation should take between 5 and 15 minutes to complete,
    depending on the system configuration.

    Warning: if you are installing LSF for AFS or DCE environments, please 
    read the README file before proceeding with the installation below.

Directory in which to install host type independent files. All the host type
independent files can be shared by all LSF hosts:
        LSF_INDEP? [? for help] [/usr/local/lsf] /lsf/local/lsf


Directory in which to install host type dependent files. All the host type
dependent files can be shared by hosts with the same host type:
        LSF_MACHDEP? [? for help] [/lsf/local/lsf]  [RETURN]
Name of the LSF cluster:
        LSF_CLUSTER_NAME? [? for help]  test_cluster
LSF administrator login name:
        LSF_MANAGER? [? for help] [lsf]  lsf


    PLEASE MAKE SURE ALL PARAMETERS ARE SET CORRECTLY BEFORE STARTING
    INSTALLING FILES.


Please choose one of the following options:

     1. List Current Settings
     2. Change Current Settings
     3. Install the Software Now
     4. Use Default Settings

     ?. Help
     q. Quit

Please enter your choice: 1

          Summary of Installation Settings

Generic parameters:

Directory where host setup will install the lsf.conf file:
        LSF_ENVDIR=/etc
Name of the LSF cluster:
        LSF_CLUSTER_NAME=test_cluster
LSF administrator login name:
        LSF_MANAGER=lsf

Path settings for machine dependent files

Directory in which to install host type dependent files. All the host type
dependent files can be shared by hosts with the same host type:
        LSF_MACHDEP=/usr/local/lsf
Directory where user commands will be installed:
        LSF_BINDIR=/usr/local/lsf/bin
Directory where LSF servers will be installed:
        LSF_SERVERDIR=/usr/local/lsf/etc
Directory where LSF library will be installed:
        LSF_LIBDIR=/usr/local/lsf/lib
Directory where the GUI UID files will be installed:
        XLSF_UIDDIR=/usr/local/lsf/lib/uid


Path settings for machine-independent files

Directory in which to install host type independent files. All the host type
independent files can be shared by all LSF hosts:
        LSF_INDEP=/usr/local/lsf
Directory where LSF cluster configuration files will be installed (must be
shared):
        LSF_CONFDIR=/usr/local/lsf/conf
Directory where Lsbatch configuration files will be installed (must be shared):
        LSB_CONFDIR=/usr/local/lsf/conf/lsbatch
Full path name of FLEXlm license file for LSF:
        LSF_LICENSE_FILE=UNDEF
Directory that Lsbatch uses for storing job data (must be shared):
        LSB_SHAREDIR=/usr/local/lsf/work
Directory where LSF man pages will be installed:
        LSF_MANDIR=/usr/local/lsf/man
Directory where LSF header file lsf/lsf.h will be installed:
        LSF_INCLUDEDIR=/usr/local/lsf/include
Installation directory for examples and other misc. files:
        LSF_MISC=/usr/local/lsf/misc
Directory where the window application resource files will be installed:
        XLSF_APPDIR=/usr/local/lsf/misc

LSF daemon message logs

Directory where LSF server error messages will be logged:
        LSF_LOGDIR=UNDEF
Syslog level to use by LSF servers:
        LSF_LOG_MASK=LOG_WARNING

Miscellaneous

Mail address format for mail from lsbatch:
        LSB_MAILTO=!U
Domain name to be stripped off the host name:
        LSF_STRIP_DOMAIN=UNDEF
Do you want to allow root to run jobs:
        LSF_ROOT_REX=n
Authentication mechanism to use:
        LSF_AUTH=UNDEF

Press Return to continue [RETURN]

Please choose one of the following options:

     1. List Current Settings
     2. Change Current Settings
     3. Install the Software Now
     4. Use Default Settings

     ?. Help
     q. Quit

Please enter your choice: 3

Checking for file system permissions ...

Checking done.


Installing LSF software. This may take a few minutes.

    Finished installing LSF on this host type.
    Installation parameters should be in /tmp/lsf/etc/lsf.conf.

    If you want to install LSF on another host type, do the following:
    -  Unpack the LSF release tar file for that host type.
    -  Log in to host of that type and change directory to the distribution 
       directory.
    -  Run lsfsetup and choose "Install Another Host Type" option.

    If you have installed LSF on all host types you want. You can now run
    lsfsetup on every host and choose Host Setup (option 6). Host Setup
    will setup the host environment for every host. See the Help option
    in lsfsetup for more details of Host Setup.

        setuid is ok.

Services seem to be already defined in NIS (YP)
Modify system startup scripts to start LSF daemons at boot time (y/n) [n] y
Adding startup code to /sbin/init.d
    ln -f -s /usr/local/lsf/etc/lsf_daemons /sbin/init.d/lsf
    ln -f -s /sbin/init.d/lsf /sbin/rc4.d/S95lsf
    ln -f -s /sbin/init.d/lsf /sbin/rc3.d/K05lsf
    Adding LSF configuration to /etc/rc.config.d/lsf
Thu Feb 22 12:09:11 EST 1996
     
    Host environment set up done for this host.

    Host Setup must be done for every host configured into LSF cluster.
    If you have not done so for other machines, do it now by running
    lsfsetup on the next host and choose Host Setup (option 6). Host Setup
    will setup the host environment for every host. See the Help option
    in lsfsetup for more details of Host Setup.

    If you have done Host Setup for all the hosts, you can now start LSF
    servers on all hosts. Follow the steps below:

    o  Verify that your configuration files are correct. You can do this
       by running lsfsetup and choose Configure LSF Cluster (option 5)
       and then choose Configuration File Error Checking (sub-option 5).
       If there are errors, correct these errors first, otherwise do next
       step.

   o  Start LSF servers by running '/usr/local/lsf/etc/lsf_daemons start'
      on every host.

   o  Run lsid to see if LSF daemons are up.

   o  Follow the steps in LSF Administrator's Guide to test various
      functions of LSF.
